isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO SERIES - REMOVE - REVERSE IDLER GEAR ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: REVERSE IDLER GEAR ASSEMBLY
svcproc.para: Before the upper reverse idler gear assembly can be removed, the mainshaft reverse gear must be positioned forward against the next gear.
While removing the reverse idler shaft, the thrust washer can drop to the transmission case bottom.
The mainshaft reverse gear must be moved to remove the upper reverse idIer gear. Refer to Mainshaft Assembly , steps 1-3.

step1.para: Use inside jaw pullers or an impact puller to remove the auxiliary countershaft front bearing from the reverse idler gear bore ( Figure 40).

figure.caption: Figure 40. Remove Auxiliary Countershaft Front Bearing

step1.para: Remove the loosened lock nut and washer from the idler shaft ( Figure 41).

figure.caption: Figure 41. Lock Nut From Idler Shaft

step1.para: Remove the pipe plug from the idIer shaft ( Figure 42).

figure.caption: Figure 42. Pipe Plug From Idler Shaft

step1.para: Install an impact puller, 1/2"-13 threaded end, and remove the shaft from case bore.
As the idler shaft and idler plate are removed, remove the thrust washer and gear.
Inspect the reverse gear assembly; replace the inner race and needle bearing if necessary.
